required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Longitudinal Study of Choroidal Changes After Cataract Surgery in Eyes With Diabetic Retinopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Longitudinal Study of Choroidal Changes Assessed With Swept-source Optical Coherence Tomography After Cataract Surgery in Eyes With Diabetic Retinopathy

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the influence of phacoemulsification on choroidal vasculature in patients with diabetic retinopathy (DR) undergoing cataract surgery

detailed_description.textblock: To determine the influence of phacoemulsification on choroidal vasculature in patients with diabetic retinopathy (DR) undergoing cataract surgery through the follow-up of choroidal thickness (CT) and choroidal vascularity index (CVI) using swept-source optical coherence tomography (SS-OCT) system.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CVI was assessed at baseline(within 1 week before surgery)
primary_outcome.description: choroidal vascularity index(CVI) was defined as the proportion of vascular area to total circumscribed area.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CVI was assessed 1 week after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: choroidal vascularity index (CVI) was defined as the proportion of vascular area to total circumscribed area.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CVI was assessed 1 month after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: choroidal vascularity index (CVI) was defined as the proportion of vascular area to total circumscribed area.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CVI was assessed 3 months after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: choroidal vascularity index (CVI)was defined as the proportion of vascular area to total circumscribed area.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CT was assessed at baseline and 1 week, 1 month, 3 month after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Choroid thickness (CT) was the thickness of the choroidal layer; CT values were obtained with the built-in software of the SS-OCT device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CT was assessed at 1 week after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Choroid thickness (CT) was the thickness of the choroidal layer; CT values were obtained with the built-in software of the SS-OCT device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CT was assessed at 1 month after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Choroid thickness (CT) was the thickness of the choroidal layer; CT values were obtained with the built-in software of the SS-OCT device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: CT was assessed at 3 months after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Choroid thickness (CT) was the thickness of the choroidal layer, CT values were obtained with the built-in software of the SS-OCT device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VD of the choriocapillaris was assessed at baseline.
primary_outcome.description: VD of the choriocapillaris was the vessel density of the choriocapillaris in the choroid.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VD of the choriocapillaris was assessed 1 week after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: VD of the choriocapillaris was the vessel density of the choriocapillaris in the choroid.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VD of the choriocapillaris was assessed 1 month after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: VD of the choriocapillaris was the vessel density of the choriocapillaris in the choroid.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VD of the choriocapillaris was assessed 3 months after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: VD of the choriocapillaris was the vessel density of the choriocapillaris in the choroid

secondary_outcome.time_frame: IOP was assessed at baseline and 1 week, 1 month, 3 month after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was the value of intraocular pressure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: IOP was assessed 1 week after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was the value of intraocular pressure .

secondary_outcome.time_frame: IOP was assessed 1 month after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was the value of intraocular pressure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: IOP was assessed 3 months after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: IOP was the value of intraocular pressure .
BCVA was the best corrected visual acuity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: BCVA was assessed 3 months after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA was the best corrected visual acuity.

arm_group.description: the cataract patients with mild/moderate NPDR

study_pop.textblock: 23 eyes of 23 cataract patients with mild/moderate NPDR without DME, and 23 age-matched non-diabetic patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- agedâ©¾40years; intraocular pressure (IOP) < 21 mm Hg in both eyes, spherical refractive error<6 diopters spherical equivalent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous retinal surgery, glaucoma, uveitis, age-related macular degeneration, arterial or vein occlusions, macular hole, or other ocular diseases that could interfere the CT and/or CVI measurement, severe systemic diseases, such as uncontrolled hypertension, obstructive sleep apnea, etc.

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
